word_mean: 扫描术：指凭视力的检查动作，如对小范围或不同孤立区域的详细检查
断续言语：说话语调表现为稍呈规律的反复停顿

sentence.Network_en: He raised the binoculars to his eye again, scanning across the scene.
sentence.Network_cn: 他再一次把双筒望远镜举到眼前，仔细观察整个现场。

sentence.Network_en: She was nervous and kept scanning the crowd for Paul.
sentence.Network_cn: 她很紧张，眼睛不停地在人群中搜寻保罗。

sentence.Network_en: She sat scanning the yellowing pages.
sentence.Network_cn: 她坐着浏览发黄的书页。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 跳读(Scanning)在英语中可解释为搜寻式阅读。跳读的目的是要从读物中迅速查获读者所需要的某一个或几个信息。
扫读（scanning）是以最快的速度扫视所读材料，在找到所需信息时才仔细阅读该项内容。如查找某个人名、地名、时间、地点等， …
如何提高英语阅读能力... ... 1. 浏览大意或略读( skimming) 2. 查读( scanning) 3. 把握主要事实( looking for important facts).
scanner unit 扫描机scanning ①扫描（的） ②全景摄影scanning agent 同位素扫描剂

list.abs: 电脑断层扫描(CT Scan)或磁力共振扫描(MRI)：帮助检查关节发炎及变形情况，有助发现早期的强直性脊椎炎。
IT专业英语词典-I ... interlaced 交织的；隔行的 interlaced scanning 交织扫描；隔行扫描 interlaced,non- 非交织的；非隔行的.
LM270WQ1 - 搜搜百科 ... 白场色度( White Field Chroma) 扫描频率（scanning frequency）( Scanning Frequency) 信号类型大类( The kind of Singnal).
5. 骨骼扫描（bone scan）：确认是否有骨骼转移。6. 病理切片检查：手术取出肿瘤以确认病理组织。

entry.def: When you scan written material, you look through it quickly in order to find important or interesting information.

example.ex: She scanned the advertisement pages of the newspapers...
example.tran: 她浏览了一下报纸的广告页。

example.ex: I haven't read much into it as yet. I've only just scanned through it.
example.tran: 我还没有细细研读，只是粗略地翻看了一下。

entry.def: When you scan a place or group of people, you look at it carefully, usually because you are looking for something or someone.

example.tran: 那名警官仔细检查了房间。

example.ex: She was nervous and kept scanning the crowd for Paul...
example.tran: 她很紧张，眼睛不停地在人群中搜寻保罗。

entry.def: If people scan something such as luggage, they examine it using a machine that can show or find things inside it that cannot be seen from the outside.

example.ex: Their approach is to scan every checked-in bag with a bomb detector.
example.tran: 他们的方法是用炸弹探测器对每一个办理了登机手续的箱包进行扫描。

entry.def: If a computer disk is scanned, a program on the computer checks the disk to make sure that it does not contain a virus.

example.ex: The disk has no viruses — I've scanned it already.
example.tran: 这个盘没有感染病毒——我已经扫描过了。

entry.def: If a picture or document is scanned into a computer, a machine passes a beam of light over it to make a copy of it in the computer.

example.ex: The entire paper contents of all libraries will eventually be scanned into computers...
example.tran: 所有图书馆的全部纸质内容最终都会被扫描进电脑。

example.ex: Designs can also be scanned in from paper.
example.tran: 设计图也可以从纸上扫描进电脑。

entry.def: If a radar or sonar machine scans an area, it examines or searches it by sending radar or sonar beams over it.

example.ex: The ship's radar scanned the sea ahead.
example.tran: 船上的雷达扫描了前方的海域。

entry.def: A scan is a medical test in which a machine sends a beam of X-rays over a part of your body in order to check that it is healthy.

example.ex: He was rushed to hospital for a brain scan.
example.tran: 他被火速送往医院做脑部扫描。

example.ex: ...a breast scan to check for cancer.
example.tran: 为诊察癌症所做的乳腺扫描检查

entry.def: If a pregnant woman has a scan, a machine using sound waves produces an image of her womb on a screen so that a doctor can see if her baby is developing normally.
If a line of a poem does not scan, it is not the right length or does not have emphasis in the right places to match the rest of the poem.

example.ex: He had written a few poems. Sid told him they didn't scan.
example.tran: 他写了几首诗。锡德告诉他那几首诗都不押韵。

means.word_mean: 1. the process of translating photographs into a digital form that can be recognized by a computer
2. the act of systematically moving a finely focused beam of light or electrons over a surface in order to produce an image of it for analysis or transmission

auth_sentence.content: Great stuff, thanks for scanning it all in.
auth_sentence.res_content: Great stuff, thanks for scanning it all in.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Great stuff, thanks for scanning it all in.

auth_sentence.content: It started scanning the pages of millions of books.
auth_sentence.res_content: It started scanning the pages of millions of books.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It started scanning the pages of millions of books.

auth_sentence.content: Scanning it all, even the college term papers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Scanning it all, even the college term papers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Scanning it all, even the college term papers.

Sentence.sentence: The second related criticism is that Google's scanning of books is actually illegal.

No one knows the precise use Google will make of the intellectual property it has gained by scanning the world's library books, and the truth, as Gleick, an American science writer and member of the Authors Guild, points out, is that the company probably doesn't even know itself
Google defends its scanning in-copyright books by saying that the online display of in-copyright books is not for commercial use.
